title: Tight Crawl 4
content:
You continue. Scrabble with fingers, brace arms, push with toes. You're definitely tilted head-down now. Is the stone pressing more tightly to either side of you?
 
Tight Crawl
You lie on your side, gasping, trying to recover some strength. Your back is sore; your neck is worse. Your head aches from cracking into unexpected stone. A cold stony knot presses into your left side, your right knee.
 
You stretch forward once more, feeling for a few more inches before you continue.
 
Splash.
 
Your fingers are submerged in water.
 
The world is becoming distant. Shock, a voice says somewhere. That makes sense, you think; you can't have lost enough blood yet to affect you directly.
options: Water at the end of crawl
"Is there a way under the water?"
